chav1961.purelib.fsys.interfaces

Interface FileSystemInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Cloneable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFileSystem, FileSystemOnFile, FileSystemOnFileSystem, FileSystemOnRMI, FileSystemOnXMLReadOnly

    public interface FileSystemInterface
extends Cloneable, Closeable

    This interface describes an abstract file system. It uses to unify access to the any data hierarchical structures can be used to keep and manipulate persistent data

    As the usual file system, the FileSystemInterface interface describes a data tree containing a set of folders and files. There is one root folder in the file system, that is a parent of all other entities. You can locate in any point of the tree, but in the only point for every time. Point of your current location in the file system is named cursor. Any operations on the file system always happen in the cursor point only. You can change the cursor location in the tree by using open(String) method. Current cursor location defines by it's path (as in the usual file system), and can be defined by getPath() method. The same last name of this path can be read by getName() method.

    When you walk on the data tree by using open(String), you can also point the cursor to non-existent paths. If you do it, you can use exists() method to test existence of this path, and isFile() / isDirectory() methods to define kind of location point of the cursor.

    To create a new entity in the file system, you need firstly point the cursor to path you want (path can be existent or not), and call one of two methods:

    • mkDir() to create a path with directory as the same last element
    • create() to create a path with empty file as the same last element

    Names of the newly created entities are the same, as getName() method returns.

    To remove any entity in the file system, you need firstly point the cursor to it, and call one of two methods:

    • delete() to delete file or empty directory
    • deleteAll() to delete non-empty directory

    To copy or move file system content from one file system to another, you need firstly point the cursor to the leaf or subtree of source file system, and call one of two methods:

    • copy(IFileSystem) to copy leaf or subtree content
    • copy(IFileSystem) to move leaf or subtree content

    Data from source file system will be copied/moved to the current location of target file system cursor, so use open(String) method for it to set the cursor to the location you wish. If you wish to copy/move data to the same file system, you need create the copy of you file system by calling clone() method. Don't use the same file system directly in the copy/move methods because file system cursor is not a reentrant resource

    Use a family of read()/readChar() methods to get content of the files in the file system, and a family of write()/wroteChar() methods to change it. Any input/output streams you got from the file system need be closed by yourself, so use try-with-resource for processing it

    Every entity in the file system has a set of attributes associated with it. Mandatory attributes of all entities are:

    • entity name (can be read by getName() method and can be changed by rename(String) method)
    • entity size in bytes (can be read by size() method and is valid for files only)
    • last modification time of the entity (can be read by lastModified() method

    All other attributes are optional and depend of the file system type. They can be read by getAttributes() method and can be changed by setAttributes(Map) method. You also can make the same operations during read/write data from/to the file

    The most of all the methods return a IFileSystemInterface as a result. This result is a 'this' reference (except unmount() method), so you can use the interface in the chained calls (for example myFileSystem.open("something").create().write()).

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961

      • clone

        Clone file system description

        Returns:
        this object clone. Clones all properties including file system mound.

      • createDataWrapper

        DataWrapperInterface createDataWrapper(URI actualPath)
                                throws IOException

        Get data wrapper interface for the given file system cursor path

        Parameters:
        actualPath - path toget data wrapper for. Always is relative, normalized and always starts with the '/'.
        Returns:
        data wrapper for the actual path. Never can be null. If object with the given path is not exists, you need at least fill the ATR_EXISTS attribute for the getAttributes() method call.
        Throws:
        IOException - if any exceptions was thrown
